content: The patient reports left wrist pain that wakes her up at night and is more bothersome than the masses. She also notes a dorsal radial mass on the left wrist and a dorsal ulnar mass on the left thumb MCP joint, which previously fluctuated in size but are now relatively constant. She was evaluated by a rheumatologist who obtained X‑rays and an ultrasound of the wrist. She presents today for further evaluation and treatment of these concerns.
title: HPI Spencer

content: On exam, left upper extremity skin is clean, dry and intact without anything by my diagnosis. There is a pea-sized mass over the first dorsal compartment. No tenderness or location over the mass. It is mobile and non-tender. Negative Finklestein, no pain with resisted thumb extension. Um, there is a mass at the dorsal ulnar aspect of the thumb MCP joint that is non-mobile and very minimally tender. Excellent range of motion at the thumb MCP. No tenderness or location at the A1 point, no locking or catching.
title: Musculoskeletal

content: outside X-rays are viewed with an osteophyte noted at the thumb MCP joint. ultrasound demonstrates a bony avulsion fragment versus osteophyte at the dorsal aspect of the MCP joint of the thumb. ultrasound of the wrist demonstrates a retinacular cyst, superficial to the first dorsal compartment sheath.
title: Imaging Results

content:
- left wrist pain
- left dorsal wrist cyst
- left thumb MCP osteophyte
- dorsal ulnar thumb MCP mass
title: Assessment

content: plan, we plan carpal tunnel, recommend night splints. recommend observation for now. aspiration versus biopsy of the wrist mass. Return to clinic in six weeks to follow up.
title: Plan
